meanings.definition: Treat (rubber) with sulfur at a high temperature to improve its strength and elasticity.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers vulcanize the rubber to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: Rubber tires are vulcanized to make them more durable.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rubber band refuse to play cards? Because it was afraid of getting vulcanized!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like rubber being vulcanized, becoming unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The process of vulcanization transforms the rubber into a resilient material.

meanings.definition: Make (rubber) hard, strong, and durable by vulcanization.
meanings.sent1: The company aims to vulcanize the rubber for better quality products.
meanings.sent2: Rubber boots are vulcanized to withstand harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rubber chicken go to school? To learn how to vulcanize its feathers!
meanings.sent4: His words had a vulcanizing effect on her resolve, making it unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The skilled workers carefully vulcanize each piece of rubber to ensure its durability.

meanings.sent1: They plan to vulcanize the rubber before assembling the final product.
meanings.sent2: The process of vulcanizing rubber involves precise temperature control.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rubber ball refuse to bounce? It was tired of being vulcanized all the time!
meanings.sent4: The team's unity was like rubber being vulcanized, bonding them together.
meanings.sent5: The factory workers carefully vulcanize each batch of rubber to ensure quality.
